org.apache.hawq.pxf.api.utilities

Class InputData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hawq.pxf.api.utilities.InputData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ProtocolData

    public class InputData
extends java.lang.Object
    Common configuration available to all PXF plugins. Represents input data coming from client applications, such as Hawq.

      • threadSafe

        protected boolean threadSafe
        When false the bridge has to run in synchronized mode. default value - true.

      • recordkeyColumn

        protected ColumnDescriptor recordkeyColumn
        The name of the recordkey column. It can appear in any location in the columns list. By specifying the recordkey column, the user declares that he is interested to receive for every record retrieved also the the recordkey in the database. The recordkey is present in HBase table (it is called rowkey), and in sequence files. When the HDFS storage element queried will not have a recordkey and the user will still specify it in the "create external table" statement, then the values for this field will be null. This field will always be the first field in the tuple returned.

      • getLogin

        public java.lang.String getLogin()
        Returns the contents of pxf_remote_service_login set in Hawq. Should the user set it to an empty string this function will return null.
        Returns:
        remote login details if set, null otherwise

      • getSecret

        public java.lang.String getSecret()
        Returns the contents of pxf_remote_service_secret set in Hawq. Should the user set it to an empty string this function will return null.
        Returns:
        remote password if set, null otherwise

      • isThreadSafe

        public boolean isThreadSafe()
        Returns whether this request is thread safe. If it is not, request will be handled consequentially and not in parallel.

        whether the request is thread safe
